description: A comprehensive tool for coloring spatial data at single-cell resolution.
name: Spaco

metadata.abstract: Understanding tissue architecture and niche-specific microenvironments in spatially resolved transcriptomics (SRT) requires in situ annotation and labeling of cells. Effective spatial visualization of these data demands appropriate colorization of numerous cell types. However, current colorization frameworks often inadequately account for the spatial relationships between cell types. This results in perceptual ambiguity in neighboring cells of biological distinct types, particularly in complex environments such as brain or tumor. To address this, we introduce Spaco, a potent tool for spatially aware colorization. Spaco utilizes the Degree of Interlacement metric to construct a weighted graph that evaluates the spatial relationships among different cell types, refining color assignments. Furthermore, Spaco incorporates an adaptive palette selection approach to amplify chromatic distinctions. When benchmarked on four diverse datasets, Spaco outperforms existing solutions, capturing complex spatial relationships and boosting visual clarity. Spaco ensures broad accessibility by accommodating color vision deficiency and offering open-accessible code in both Python and R.
metadata.title: Spaco: A comprehensive tool for coloring spatial data at single-cell resolution
